phase_history.notes: Full Mutable Instruments Clouds VST adaptation - 4 modes, 13 parameters, modern UI
Multi-mode granular processor with 4 distinct DSP algorithms. Complexity 5/5 requires WebView for rich visualization and complex parameter management.

WebView UI design with teal color scheme (#427E88), 5x2 knob grid layout, knobs rotated -90Â° (gap at bottom), tall input/output meters (240px), grain activity visualization canvas. Window size: 800x500px. Design files: v4-test.html, v4-ui-spec.md

Phase 4.1.1 complete: Core infrastructure implemented with WebView UI integration, parameter smoothing, quality management, sample mode switching (Vintage 32kHz/Modern native), circular grain buffer with freeze, granular synthesis engine (Mode 0) with 64 concurrent grains, envelope tables (Hann/Triangle/Exponential), and basic effects placeholders. PluginProcessor/Editor created with proper WebView2 setup. Modes 1-3 are placeholders awaiting Phase 4.1.2.

GUI visualization connected to real audio signals: (1) Input/output level meters now display actual audio levels via atomic floats and 30Hz timer callback, (2) Cloud dots animation now reacts to active grain count (0-64), density parameter (particle speed), and texture parameter (particle size/color), (3) Removed placeholder random animations and replaced with real-time data from DSP engine.

ALL FOUR MODES IMPLEMENTED: Mode 0 (Granular) - 64 grains with cubic size scaling (20-500ms), interpolated playback from 384k sample buffer. Mode 1 (WSOLA Pitch-Shifter) - Dual-window time-stretching with correlation matching, 128-4096 sample windows. Mode 2 (Looping Delay) - Pitch-shifted loops with 64-sample crossfades, tap-tempo sync. Mode 3 (Spectral) - 4096-point FFT phase vocoder with quantization, warping, pitch shifting. REVERB FIXED: Replaced incorrect JUCE reverb with proper Dattorro topology (Griesinger/4 input diffusers, 8 main delays, dual LFOs). BUFFER CORRECTED: Increased from 256 to 384,000 samples (8 seconds @ 48kHz). GRAIN ENGINE FIXED: Cubic size scaling, proper position mapping, linear interpolation for smooth pitch shifting. Based on comprehensive analysis of Mutable Instruments Clouds source code (https://github.com/pichenettes/eurorack).

implementation_progress.notes: All four processing modes fully implemented with correct algorithms from Clouds source. Reverb uses proper Dattorro topology. Buffer size corrected to 8 seconds. All DSP parameters verified against hardware reference.

framework_selection.rationale: WebView framework selected for CloudWash due to: (1) High complexity (5/5) with 13 parameters requiring sophisticated layout, (2) 4 distinct processing modes needing clear visual distinction and mode indicator, (3) Modern/clean aesthetic requirement from ideation phase favors WebView's design flexibility, (4) Rich visualization opportunities (grain activity, spectral display, freeze state LED), (5) Interactive controls benefit from web-based UI patterns. While Visage could handle the parameter count, WebView provides superior visual feedback and mode-switching UX for this complex granular processor.
